me
2017/KER/49771
SUNIL THOMAS, J.
Crl.M.C.No.7531 of 2017
Dated this the 8° day of December, 2017
ORDER

Petitioners herein are arrayed as accused in Crime
No.232 of 2014 of Payyannur Police Station for offences punishable
under sections 498A, 294(b), 323 r/w 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

2. It was alleged by the prosecution that the petitioners
herein, who are the husband and in-laws of the second respondent
herein, subjected the second respondent to matrimonial cruelty.
Alleging it, she laid the complaint, which ultimately led to the
registration of the crime and filing of the final report. The matter is
pending as C.C.No.729 of 2014 of Judicial First Class Magistrate
Court, Payyannur.

3. Petitioners have now approached this Court contending
that the disputes have been completely resolved and parties have no
objection in quashing the proceedings. Learned counsel for the
petitioners and the learned counsel for the second respondent
referred to Annexure-A2 affidavit, affirmed by the second
respondent, reiterating the settlement. Learned counsel for the
second respondent submitted that the matter has been settled and
she has no objection in quashing the proceedings. Learned Public
Prosecutor, on instructions, submitted that the matter has now been

Bel
aera
2017/KER/49771
Crl.M.C.753 1/17
2
settled and statement of the victim recorded. Having considered
these facts, I am inclined to invoke the jurisdiction under section
482 Cr.P.C.
In the result, Crl.M.C is allowed. All further proceedings
in C.C.No.729 of 2014 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court,
Payyannur arising from Crime No.232 of 2014 of Payyannur Police
Station will stand quashed
